meanings.sent1: The phoney diamond turned out to be just a shiny piece of glass.
meanings.sent2: She knew the designer bag was phoney because the logo was misspelled.
meanings.sent3: The phoney magician's tricks always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: His phoney smile couldn't hide the sadness in his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The phoney gold watch tarnished after just a few days.

meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be something they are not
meanings.sent1: The con artist was a phoney who tricked people with fake stories.
meanings.sent2: She realized her friend was a phoney when she caught her in a lie.
meanings.sent3: The phoney prince turned out to be a regular guy in disguise.
meanings.sent4: The phoney actor's true identity was finally revealed on stage.
meanings.sent5: The phoney detective was actually the culprit all along.

meanings.definition: To falsely represent oneself or something as genuine or true
meanings.sent1: He tried to phoney his way into the exclusive club by pretending to be a VIP.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to phoney her qualifications on her resume.
meanings.sent3: The student decided to phoney his excuse for not doing the homework.
meanings.sent4: The company was caught trying to phoney their sales numbers.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to phoney his support backfired.
